body:
push is just a concept, in network, except deal with TCP. directly, there is no real push. Also client ask server side for new settings. 

there is no different in features.
@candyleer  @liuhaoyang  The 5.0.0-beta tested and we are going to send the vote mail about 5.0-beta release next week. I will close this issue. Please open a new issue if anybody has any issue.

Thanks everyone. Before and during release vote, feel free to open question. Especially for @liuhaoyang about .NET CORE related features. Native release supported is very important.

The PMC will consider the issue, whether it blocks the end user.
@candyleer nice work !
You only need to change `public TraceSegmentRef(ContextSnapshot snapshot)`, to set the parentApplicationInstanceId as the current instanceId.
Yes,in `public TraceSegmentRef(ContextSnapshot snapshot)` ,the field is setted,but `transform()` missed this field ,I fixed in pr #1175

for example ,you have two environment ,so you will deploy two clusters of collector ,and also elasticsearch. but for ui,  I  want to deploy just one cluster, and there is a drop down box in the ui ,which can switch environment  to view diffrent data in diffrent elasticsearch clusters.

Oh, I see. This is a complex requirement. I doubt the UI team will be interested in this feature. 

ping @hanahmily What do you thing?
Alarm features are not the core features for now. Move to 5.1 for further evaluation.
Alarm feature need further evaluation.

Is it possible to support spans to collapse and expand based on dependencies? 
Just like zipkin:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10701915/39747608-57df435e-52e0-11e8-9fe4-9efd9c65e960.png)

I and @hanahmily have some aggressive ideas, but we are afraid may effect the stable. So may choose an easy but better way to fix this. 

Then we can release our 5.0.0-GA. I think the community really need this version.

FYI @peng-yongsheng Please just review this, don't merge this. Hold this for beta2.
@candyleer Try to search service_name separate by `.` such as `skywalking.incubator.apache.org`.

@candyleer I want to clear about @peng-yongsheng 's requests. Some of our operation names are using packageName.className.methodName, so we need make sure the new match works in these scenario.

Please check with operation names including `.`, `/` or both. Thanks.

I confirmed with the users, they clear ElasticSearch, but don't reboot the monitored application(agent). So no node register and calls between unexist nodes still happen. Which could trigger this problem.

@peng-yongsheng We may need to consider to check application instance id when we receive data. 

If the check mechanism provided, agent may provide a re-register mechanism after receive invalid instance id, and all local caches could be removed. We need to remove the blocking in these uncompatible upgrade.

What do you think?

1. `#activeSpan` 's NPE is always triggered by the span started in another thread.
1. ContextSnapshot missing may be caused by some methods are not intercepted.

I agree this graph makes me confuse too. And I think the contributed async http client plugin is not good enough. Could you consider to provide a new one?

In ideal, one local span in main thread(segment) represents the prepare async http, another exit span in sub thread(segment) with ref, which points to the prev local span, represents the real http request(including the duration)

for current version ,one request contains 2 exit span and 3 local span
for above image. I think `AsyncThread/excute` and `/test` are enough (one local and one exit)
This recheck service works for me. And I highly recommend we support this in beta2. @hanahmily @ascrutae @liuhaoyang @candyleer thoughts?
ok.I will test latter
I will support this in .NET Agent v0.3.

[![Coverage Status](https://coveralls.io/builds/16900247/badge)](https://coveralls.io/builds/16900247)

Coverage remained the same at 23.362% when pulling **8eaec2d5d5d5bf27c12768d90c835b414d5a670d on submodule/ui** into **1b85bef24017195e969304b753a76c80a9ebf9d9 on master**.

the result may be 
```
---main-----
                ------------------thread-3------------------
                  ----------------request span-------------
```
the difference is thread-3 is not started in main thread(not like cross thread) at least they can related each other

The stream screen snapshot:
![181525867504_ pic_hd](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12436447/39814001-4ea87996-53c5-11e8-86be-c790237fcec4.jpg)

The blocking screen snapshot:
![191525867627_ pic_hd](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12436447/39814004-5082a9a8-53c5-11e8-9e37-35d4af310ee5.jpg)

The future screen snapshot:
![201525867767_ pic_hd](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12436447/39814006-5220ac42-53c5-11e8-9314-8cb47a810250.jpg)
Also related #1199 bug.
get it

This is a very typical across-thread scenario, whether cross two or three threads. You should find a way hold **Snapshot** created in main thread, and ref it in the send thread. In the send thread, you also create a new segment and new Exit span with the hold **Snapshot**.
Replace by #1202
I will close this for now. No further report since alpha release.
I agree that. And I think we are welcome to discuss and accept this filter mechanism as an optional plugin.
understand,I have some solution

This is caused by @ascrutae 's deployment mistakes. In the demo env, the buffer folders of two collector instance are same. As the result, collector can't read the buffer file correctly. I will submit a new requirement for add a `.lock` file to the buffer folder to avoid this situation.

You could set the log level to **OFF**.
```
# Logging level
logging.level=OFF
```
Because the trace query is based on trace segment, not trace. In a distributed system, you can't use a single id to represent a trace. Please consider MQ or other batch consume scenarios.
Fixed in #1190

FYI @candyleer welcome to join the reviewer team.

For validate your plugin, there are several steps you should follow:
1. Provide Topology, trace and service map to prove your data.
1. Follow this doc: https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases/blob/master/docs/how-to-write-a-plugin-testcase-cn.md , to provide your test case
1. Ask PMC team to run test case in SkyWalking Infra.

@leizhiyuan My suggestion is based on operation name is treated as a string only, and I saw dot and method name in it. So the agent, backend should not have any magic power to replace substring to null.

Of course, the debug will tell what happens.
定位不到问题发生的原因；

This is known issues by the version 3.2.6, suggest upgrade to version 5.0.0-alpha.
And 5.0.0-beta version is in releasing process.

Dubbo has it because dubbo is our first plugin, some no-dubbo test codes are in it, because it need test in plugin modules.
I will test it and provide report in https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases .

What do you mean about stack number? The whole project is working on 5.x series. Especially beta releases soon, maybe you want to try that.

Yes ,I tested, it works .it just like 
```
select * from table where service_name like "%value%"
```

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2684384/39975112-40e321f6-575f-11e8-8bfc-4e895f779cb3.png)

I debuged locally, you can see the stack elements(the pic may load slowly,wait a minute),interfaceName is absolutely not null, is it possible because of transient keyword?
```
    /**
     * 接口名
     */
    private transient String               interfaceName;
```

any ideas about classes or methods should I debug during sending to skywalking-ui ?
@leizhiyuan You could debug the `TracingContext#finish`. The `TraceSegment` in the method should contain all the data you need.
ignore me
sky walking是否提供python 的api?

You could see from the readme. SkyWalking is supporting multiple languages, Java, .NET, Nodejs. Go is still ongoing. But you should understand , we didn't provide API for each language, the cummunity did.

Such as: Java from several developers, I just lead. @liuhaoyang leads the .NET. @ascrutae leads the nodejs. So if you want a python version, you could create one, and we can work together.

For multiple languages, SkyWalking provided protocol support: 
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/5441976/39981426-22a32a5a-5783-11e8-9b1e-705279f6669a.png)
These two protocols should be supported by every language.

@wu-sheng thanks a lot, I will resolve the conflicts and mentions.

@leizhiyuan Ping us when you are ready (after release). 

And I have to ask, where does https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/skywalking-agent-testcases/pull/17#issuecomment-388741798 base? I guess 5.4.0 is not released, yet.  FYI @ascrutae

@wu-sheng  It based my local machine. I installed sofarpc 5.4.0 to my local m2 repo

I tested it like this.

env settings
```
export project_name=sofarpc-scenario
export agent_repository_branch=sofarpc-integration
export agent_repository_url=https://github.com/leizhiyuan/incubator-skywalking.git
export testcase_branch=sofarpc-testcase-scenario
```
test command
```
 sh deploy-test.sh \
-p ${project_name} \
-b ${agent_repository_branch} \
-r ${agent_repository_url} \
-tcb ${testcase_branch}
```

after run this ,It asks me provide password of github to publish reports . I can not access master branch ('https://github.com/SkywalkingTest/agent-integration-test-report.git/'),so I copied it there to inform you
When we release sofarpc 5.4.0 I will provide a new test report
The 5.0 operation document is not updated accordingly.
